answers.answer: You didn't mention whether your husband is controlling and managing his glucose [blood sugar] levels. If not, better control and management is very important to prevent the onset of health issues.Itchy skin can have hundreds of possible causes; Nerve damage caused by uncontrolled diabetes is associated with itchy skin but so are allergies to fragrances [bath and/or laundry soap], skin conditions such as pruritus [dry skin in seniors], eczema and psoriasis, and so on. Other causes are internal organ disease/failure - kidney and/or liver.Take him to a doctor asap for a thorough evaluation. Hopefully it's something as simple as pruritus not  the onset of renal failure.

Hi there,Itching, leg pains aka diabetic nerve pains are common symptoms  among long time, full blown diabetic 2.To me, just lower the A1c another words control blood sugar tightly every day until the A1c reach 5.8 % or lower.
